author: Shadow_Crawler
title: WIZARD!
review: Well, as an impulse, this set has done its job (attract hose who haven't know about LEGO) very well. I was used to like EXO-FORCE, but I turn my back since I know about the discontinue of it and began searching for another unique theme. I buy this set with a 10% discount on my local toystore. This set is impressive. The bird were nothing, although it's still unique. The glass globe was cool, with a yellow-colored jewel in it. Most of all, the wizard. His appearance is very attracting, mostly the hat and the beard. This set also has a lot of playability. Great set!

author: Gus_263
title: Impulse: The Good Wizard
review: This set is another set from the Castle new sets and also a impulse set. Like all the other Impulse, the set have few pieces and is so small. It have some useful pieces like the crystal ball, but 16 pieces are really few. The minifigure included is different from some of the new castle sets and also different from the old wizards on the classic castle sets. This minifigure is good designed but not like the old wizard minifigure. This have a gray cool color, but stars on his hat makes it is silly, like the name good wizard, because the story is made by the owner of the set. The staff is small and with no new features. The owl minifigure is nice detailed but with bad color differences, is completely white. This set is basic, and with really few pieces and so much easy building, that makes it be boring. The useful pieces are few and bad builted in this set. The figure have a cool color but the simple design of the old wizard minifigure in the classic castle is much better. Finally, i say again that the 16 few pieces are bad used in this set. So, i rate the Impulse and Castle set "The Good Wizard" 3/5

author: mike2008
title: The good wizard. An essential part from every army.
review:
The good wizard set is a small set with a great price tag (wish I had 2 of them).
Let’s start with the minifig: The wizard looks great, but his torso is unpainted. This is ok as long as the wizard got his beard. 

The wizard's wand is great, not like the fairy tale type wand found in the earlier castle sets. 
The only draw back to the set is the lack of base. 
Even a 4x4 base would add a lot to the set. 

My rate is 4.5 out of 5.

author: legoguysw
title: A nice addition to any Lego castle
review:
I got this from LegoLand Windsor, and its my first ever castle set! Anyway, the review:
MINIFGS
Like all Impulse sets, this set includes 1 minifig, a wizard. Yay! He has a nice hat, and a beard, and nice PRINTED legs. You don't see many of those. His torso is plain, which is fine cause of the beard blocking it. Did I mention the beard yet? I love it! You don't see many of those, either. He also has a brown stick, or staff
FURNITURE
This wizard has a crystal ball. It has a crystal inside it, no surprise there. The part that makes up the 'ball' in 'crystal ball' is cool, It fits the part well. I think I have to say that it is does fit over a minifig head, sort of.
The wizard also has a shelf thing, which his nice owl sits on. Nothing more to say there.
Throw in an potion or 2, and this set will be BRILLIANT. For now, its just good, but still a 5. Lego fans, get one. Castle fans, get multiples!

author: allencao3
title: Where is the robe?
review:
How could the crownies possibly win the battle against mighty creatures like dragons without a wizard? And that’s why this set appeared on my shopping list. It is still kinda weird to me why the wizard came in an impulse set though. I guess nobody would buy a whole bunch of wizards under any circumstances… But it is still good for castle fans, price wise.

It IS really a small set so I don’t have much to say just a couple of points, mainly things that I am not satisfied about
- ROBE!! The wizard looks lame without a robe or a cape for the necromancer would do too.
- I am personally not a fan of the grayish blue color.  Maybe he will be upgraded to a white wizard later like Gandalf?
- There could have been a nicer staff too.
- The white owl is a nice idea but cannot be recognized from a distance.
- The color scheme of the crystal ball and the table is not that good.

I probably should not be too harsh on such a teeny set. But there are certain improvements that could be made. Like it or not, a castle fan would still buy this anyway.

author: Harmonious_Building
title: A kind of magic.
review:
And so it is that LEGO continues to taunt us by releasing new wizards but not giving us a fully-fledged wizard faction to include in our medieval fantasy worlds. One would think that the Fantasy Era subtheme would have provided a perfect excuse for LEGO to do exactly such a thing, but alas, it was not to be, and all we have is The Good Wizard to remind us of what might have been.

The Good Wizard might be considered to be the spiritual successor to Majisto the Wizard, seen way back in the Dragon Knights subtheme of Castle. Since the Undead faction has a mighty wizard of its own as seen in the now-absurdly-difficult-to-find Skeleton Tower (7093), I suppose it only makes sense that the "good guys" get a spellcaster of their own. He's considerably more detailed than his Dragon Knights counterpart, although I find the stars on his hat to be a little corny.

Other than that, you get a little viewing crystal, a Harry Potter-esque owl, and an owl perch for the owl to sit on. The crystal ball piece is cool, but otherwise, there's nothing too special here. In truth, I'm slightly more fond of the setup found in Kingdoms' Wizard (7955), which somehow seems more useful and thematically coherent. The downside is that the wizard in 7955, strangely, has a completely bare torso whereas the Good Wizard's is printed.

This is a nice companion set to have if you'd like to add a little bit of variety to your castle battles, but I wouldn't call it essential since I don't quite see the Crown Knights as being particularly inclined towards magic. Now that the Lord of Rings sets are out in full swing, the prospect of seeing a magical Castle clan grows ever more dim...I'm still holding my breath, though.

author: Ernst
title: Good Wizard, great color !
review:
Overall 4 bricks : A good addition to the Fantasy Era collection and a cute set to see. Very nice coloured Magician with nice accesoires for a nice price. Not a must have but if you collect Castle sets don't let it slip away.

 

Building 2 bricks : I can't call the assembling of a minifigure, a table with crystal ball and the stand of the Owl building so 2 bricks are sufficient.

 

Parts 4 bricks : great minifigure, I love the color he comes in. Other parts are nice too, also usefull in other sets like the owl and the crystal ball.

 

Playability 3 bricks : on its own not much fun but combined with other Castle sets it has enough possibilities.

 

Value 3 bricks : Bricklink shows an average of €3,50 for this small set which is ok if you are a Castle collector.
